channel.title: Public boolean inWoodcuttingGuild
channel.description:
Hey, pretty simple I'm guessing:
In my Player class I have:
[code] public boolean inWoodcuttingGuild() { if (absX >= 2429 && absX <= 2499 && absY >= 9854 && absY <= 9924) { return true; } return false; } [/code]
and then in my ObjectManager class I have:
[code] public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) { if (p.inWoodcuttingGuild()) { c.getPA().object(1309,2435,9875, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Yew tree c.getPA().object(1309,2434,9872, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Yew tree
c.getPA().object(1306,2465,9871, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree c.getPA().object(1306,2467,9872, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree c.getPA().object(1306,2471,9874, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree c.getPA().object(8430,2466,9873, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree
c.getPA().object(1281,2459,9895, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Oak tree
c.getPA().object(9036,2463,9895, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9896, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9897, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree c.getPA().object(9036,2463,9898, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9898, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9895, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree
c.getPA().object(2213,2463,9897, -1, 10);//Woodcutting guild Bank booth c.getPA().object(2213,2463,9896, -1, 10);//Woodcutting guild Bank booth }
} [/code]
But my compiler cannot find symbol: p.inWoodcuttingGuild().
I'm doing this because the trees spawn at every heightLevel and I cannot determine the heightLevel because my Woodcutting guild is under ground so it's heightLevel = 0, the same as if I was above ground.
The objects appear at every height, so I'm trying to declare them only when I'm in the Woodcutting guild. Do I need to implement something like (Player p) or something for p.inWoodcuttingGuild to work? I've tried various alterations but just cannot get it.
Any help appreciated, thanks for reading.

item.title: Public boolean inWoodcuttingGuild
item.dc:creator: @Kecea Kecea
item.description:
@Kecea wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:16, topic:383825”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=479591.msg3511847#msg3511847 date=1298636834]
Thanks Vain. That was a very insightful explanation, now I understand how it works a bit more.

@xxxxxx 13: :o
[/quote]Yeah you just had to see there was no instanced reference to the Player class, so you cannot use it. Remember you can use Player instead of Client as it inherits its methods and variables. They’re also connected, so that they’re are theoretically the same instance.[/quote]No. You cannot use methods from the Client class using an instance of the Player class.

Read full topic

item.title: Public boolean inWoodcuttingGuild
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:16, topic:383825”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=479591.msg3511847#msg3511847 date=1298636834]
Thanks Vain. That was a very insightful explanation, now I understand how it works a bit more.

@xxxxxx 13: :o
[/quote]Yeah you just had to see there was no instanced reference to the Player class, so you cannot use it. Remember you can use Player instead of Client as it inherits its methods and variables. They’re also connected, so that they’re are theoretically the same instance.[/quote]
Yeah, although I tried Player.inWoodcuttingGuild and it was out of context or something…

Read full topic

@xxxxxx 13: :o[/quote]Yeah you just had to see there was no instanced reference to the Player class, so you cannot use it. Remember you can use Player instead of Client as it inherits its methods and variables. They’re also connected, so that they’re are theoretically the same instance.

c.getPA().object(1309,2435,9875, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Yew tree

item.title: Public boolean inWoodcuttingGuild
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Hey, pretty simple I’m guessing:

In my Player class I have:

public boolean inWoodcuttingGuild() {
		if (absX >= 2429 && absX <= 2499 && absY >= 9854 && absY <= 9924) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

and then in my ObjectManager class I have:

public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {
	if (p.inWoodcuttingGuild()) {
		c.getPA().object(1309,2435,9875, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Yew tree
		c.getPA().object(1309,2434,9872, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Yew tree

		c.getPA().object(1306,2465,9871, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree
		c.getPA().object(1306,2467,9872, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree
		c.getPA().object(1306,2471,9874, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree
		c.getPA().object(8430,2466,9873, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Magic tree

		c.getPA().object(1281,2459,9895, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Oak tree

		c.getPA().object(9036,2463,9895, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree
		c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9896, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree
		c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9897, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree
		c.getPA().object(9036,2463,9898, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree
		c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9898, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree
		c.getPA().object(9036,2462,9895, 0, 10);//Woodcutting guild Teak tree

		c.getPA().object(2213,2463,9897, -1, 10);//Woodcutting guild Bank booth
		c.getPA().object(2213,2463,9896, -1, 10);//Woodcutting guild Bank booth
		}
		
	}

But my compiler cannot find symbol: p.inWoodcuttingGuild().

I’m doing this because the trees spawn at every heightLevel and I cannot determine the heightLevel because my Woodcutting guild is under ground so it’s heightLevel = 0, the same as if I was above ground.

The objects appear at every height, so I’m trying to declare them only when I’m in the Woodcutting guild. Do I need to implement something like (Player p) or something for p.inWoodcuttingGuild to work? I’ve tried various alterations but just cannot get it.

Any help appreciated, thanks for reading.

Read full topic
